intro: Streptocarpus albus subsp. edwardsii, commonly known as the White Streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has oval, glossy leaves and produces showy inflorescences that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. This subspecies is distinct from other Streptocarpus species by its specific floral morphology and habitat preferences.
